Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 10:41AM mzsumthing wrote:  My sister's pallative physican and consultants informed us in the very beginning that my sister would not be able to just stop taking pains medication without experiencing some withdrawal symptoms. Especially, if she is on the pain meds for a long period of time. The physician said they would gradually reduced her meds over a period of time to where she would be taken off....

Posts.Title: Pain/Discomfort after PET? mzsumthing joaniji

Posts.Content: mzsumthing wrote: Has anyone experience pain or discomfort after having PET scans? My sister tends to experience aches, pain, and stomach issues directly after having PET scans. She dreads having them performed. I plan on bring this to her oncologists attention, again. Her oncologist seems to ignore our concerns about her symptoms. However, I am going to bring it to his attention later this week.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain/Discomfort after PET? mzsumthing joaniji

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2012 06:40PM mzsumthing wrote: She had a PET/CT scan performed last Friday. I was also thinking she may be having some type of reaction to CT contrast.  She seems to think the problems are resulting from PET scan., as she has had CT's performed w/o PET and have not experience any pain or discomfort.
